page.title: 02WATER OF LEITH
page.content: We have been studying the vegetation along the Water of Leith from Powder- :hall to Ferry Road. Here are the results. {Wild Vegetation Landscaped Vegetation Ivy, Nettles, Primrose, Oak Tree, Thistles, Yarrow Rhododendron, Lime, Ferns, Foxglove Elderberry, Beech, Hogweed, Reeds, Sycamore, Ash, Old Man's Beard Pussy Willow {Pollution Parts of the Water of Leith are very beautiful, but pollution has spoiled some areas. There is much rubbish in the water; e.g. tin cans, wood, bits of metal, plastic bottles. Graffiti on the walls spoils the appearance of the walkway. Despite this it is a popular place. Certain amenities have been provided such as benches, a play- :park and a tiled pathway so that you can enjoy your walk.
